chapter.title: Application suite
chapter.subtitle: Applications shipped with &PROD;
chapter.para: &PROD; comes with a number of supporting applications that you can use to quickly set up clustering on your own data, further tune clustering results and expose &PROD; clustering as a remote service.

formalpara.title: &DCW;
formalpara.para: which is a standalone GUI application you can use to experiment with &PROD; clustering on data from common search engines or your own data.

formalpara.title: &DCS;
formalpara.para: which exposes &PROD; clustering as a REST service.

formalpara.title: &WA;
formalpara.para: which exposes &PROD; clustering as a web application for end users.

section.title: &DCW;
section.para: &DCW; is a standalone GUI application you can use to experiment with &PROD; clustering on data from common search engines or your own data.

formalpara.title: Various document sources included.
formalpara.para: &DCW; can fetch and cluster documents from a number of sources, including major search engines, indexing engines (Lucene, Solr, Google Desktop) as well as generic XML feeds and files.

formalpara.title: Live tuning of clustering algorithm attributes.
formalpara.para: &DCW; enables modifying clustering algorithm's attributes and observing the results in real time.

formalpara.title: Performance benchmarking.
formalpara.para: &DCW; can run simple performance benchmarks of &PROD; clustering algorithms.

formalpara.title: Attractive visualizations.
formalpara.para: &DCW; comes with two visualizations of the cluster structure, one developed within the &PROD; project and another one from Aduna Software.

formalpara.title: Modular architecture and extendability.
formalpara.para: &DCW; is based on Eclipse Rich Client Platform, which makes it easily extendable.

listitem.para: Quickly test &PROD; clustering with your own data. Please see for instructions for the most common scenarios.
Fine tune &PROD; clustering algorithms' settings to work best with your specific data. Please see for more details.
Run simple performance benchmarks using different settings to predict maximum clustering throughput on a single machine. Please see for details.
Download and install Java Runtime Environment (version 1.5.0 or newer) if you have not done so
Download &DCW; Windows binaries or Linux binaries and extract the archive to some local disk location.

section.title: &DCS;
section.para: &DCS; (DCS) exposes &PROD; clustering as a REST service. It can cluster documents from an external source (e.g. a search engine) or documents provided directly as an XML stream and returns results in XML or JSON formats.

formalpara.title: XML and JSON response formats.
formalpara.para: &DCS; can return results both in XML and JSON formats. JSON-P (with callback) is also supported.

formalpara.title: Various document sources included.
formalpara.para: &DCS; can fetch and cluster documents from a large number of sources, including major search engines and indexing engines (Lucene, Solr).

formalpara.title: Direct XML feed.
formalpara.para: &DCS; can cluster documents fed directly in a simple XML format.

formalpara.title: PHP and C# examples included.
formalpara.para: &DCS; ships with ready-to-use examples of calling &PROD; DCS services from PHP (version 5), C#, Ruby, Java and curl.

formalpara.title: Quick start screen.
formalpara.para: A simple quick start screen will let you make your first DCS request straight from your browser.

listitem.para: Build a high-throughput document clustering system by setting up a number of load-balanced instances of the DCS.
Download and install Java Runtime Environment (version 1.5.0 or newer) if you have not done so
Download &DCS; binaries and extract the archive to some local disk location.
Point your browser to http://localhost:8080 for further instructions
See the examples/ directory in the distribution archive for PHP, C#, Ruby and Java code examples. You can also invoke DCS clustering using the curl command.

To deploy the DCS in an external servlet container, such as Apache Tomcat, use the &PRODID;-dcs.war file from the war/ folder of the DCS distribution.

section.title: &WA;
section.para: &WA; exposes &PROD; clustering as a web application for end users. It allows users to browse clusters using a conventional tree view, but also in an attractive visualization.

formalpara.title: Two cluster views.
formalpara.para: &WA; offers two views of the clusters generated by &PROD;: conventional tree view and a Flash-based visualization.

formalpara.title: All &PROD; document sources and algorithms included.
formalpara.para: &WA; contains a large number of document sources, including major search engines. Optionally, further document sources can be added, such as Lucene or Solr ones. It also contains all &PROD;'s clustering algorithms.

formalpara.title: XSLT and JavaScript-based presentation layer.
formalpara.para: Look & feel of the &WA; can be easily changed by editing a number of XSLT style sheets. All common style sheets and JavaScripts can be re-used when implementing a new look & feel.

formalpara.title: High-performance front-end.
formalpara.para: The front-end of the &WA; has been optimized for fast loading by using such techniques as JavaScript and CSS merging and minification, as well as using CSS sprites.

listitem.para: Make sure you have access to a Servlet API 2.4 compliant container, such as Apache Tomcat.
Deploy the WAR file to your servlet container.
